newsitem.title: USA: Invacare to appeal ruling for Healthdyne.
newsitem.headline: Invacare to appeal ruling for Healthdyne.

text.p: Invacare said Monday it is appealing a July 3 district court decision in favor of Healthdyne Technologies Inc.
The ruling upheld a specific provision that only allows continuing directors to nullify the company's poison pill provisions, said Invacare spokesman Mark Harnett.
Invacare, which has been seeking to acquire Healthdyne in a hostile bid since January, had sought a motion from the court to strike out the provision, Harnett said.
"We are, of course, disappointed at the court's rulings, and are confident that the appellate court will see things differently," Invacare said in a statement.
Invacare's bid for Healthdyne is now valued at about $200 million. Its latest offer to acquire all outstanding shares of Healthdyne common stock at $15 a share is scheduled to expire August 1.
